title: Chapter 18
content:
Chapter 18

◎Mid-Autumn Festival◎

"It's late, aren't you going to rest?" Li Cheng leaned against the bed, hinting with his words.

Tomorrow was Mid-Autumn Festival, and after that, he would have to go to Huai-Sui to train the navy, leaving no time for them. The couple naturally wanted to make the most of their time together.

Although Huiyin had repelled Xun Rou, she did not feel particularly happy. She turned her head to look at him: "Hasn't Cousin Xun been staying in your household for many years, prepared to be your fiancée? It’s a pity when I think about it."

Li Cheng hadn’t expected her to be so sentimental. He originally thought she would be pleased with his actions. No one likes to be seen as heartless or unfeeling. He looked at Huiyin and said, "I don’t want to lie to you. If I really wanted to marry someone, it wouldn’t matter if she were the daughter of an official or an orphan; I would still want to marry her."

"Do you mean you don’t like her?" Huiyin asked.

"As a sister and family member, I do like her. After all, we grew up together. Later, when I joined Uncle Wei Wang, they followed me without hesitation, and I am very grateful for that. But when it comes to marriage, I haven’t considered her. She is good, being my grandmother’s great-niece, but just because someone is good doesn’t mean I like them." Li Cheng made his point clear.

In fact, Li Cheng was being quite tactful. When Xun Rou was younger, she had often shown affection towards him. That was why he specifically built a residence in Xuzhou, preferring not to return to Jianye.

Even Grand Dowager Wu had sent him nourishing soups, thrown handkerchiefs, and deliberately made eye contact, using every possible means.

Huiyin was satisfied by his explanation: "I’m really glad you think this way. There was once a man who claimed to be smitten with me at first sight, threatening to die if I didn’t marry him. My father was almost moved, saying he was a fine young man with a good family background, but I just couldn’t stand the idea of marrying someone I didn’t like, no matter how much they threatened me."

Li Cheng hadn’t expected that two people who hated being coerced into arrangements would end up married, and even in a blind marriage. The more he thought about it, the more incredible it seemed.

With the misunderstanding cleared, the slight irritation in Huiyin’s heart dissipated. She offered a way out: "This year is my first as a bride, and I haven’t sent any gifts to my natal home for the festival. I’ll prepare them along with the New Year’s gifts."

Li Cheng smiled: "Good, send a gift to your sister in the Eastern Palace as well, and to your brother."

As the saying goes, lovebirds entwined, how blissful.

On the other side, Zheng Deyin had just received the emperor's favor. This time, the Crown Prince entrusted her with organizing the Mid-Autumn Festival banquet at the Eastern Palace, and she was determined to showcase her best skills, unwilling to be looked down upon.

However, she felt guilty towards Crown Princess Lu Xiao, so while lying in bed with Li Hang, she could not help but say, "Today, the embroidery bureau made a beautiful rose-colored dress. I thought it would suit the Crown Princess well, so I sent it to her. Tomorrow, although I will be in charge of the arrangements, I am also serving the Crown Princess. I only wish for the Crown Prince and the Crown Princess to have a grandchild soon, which would make me very happy."

These words were, of course, insincere. Li Hang, who grew up in the palace, understood these tactics well. Zheng Deyin often used this approach to gain power while still appearing virtuous.

But Li Hang still praised her, saying, "Your thoughts are commendable, but I only want to have children with you."

Zheng Deyin blushed coyly, "Your Highness, if others heard such words, it wouldn't be proper."

"What did they hear?" Li Hang teased, but he found Zheng Deyin too stiff in bed, losing his interest. However, thinking about the need to incite conflict between the Zheng family and the Lu family, he decided to continue. He spoke about the frustrations in court, and when Zheng Deyin heard that the Crown Prince was being controlled by Lu Wei, she felt secretly saddened.

The next day, when Elder Madame Xu came to pay respects, Zheng Deyin confided in her, "The Crown Prince is now feeling frustrated and unfulfilled, but he treats me very well. Grandmother, could you ask Father to help the Crown Prince?"

Elder Madame Xu stroked her hand, "Does the Crown Prince really treat you well?"

"Yes, the Crown Prince has visited the harem for over twenty days in the past month, and twenty of those days were spent here with me. He treats the Crown Princess indifferently, and even because of Lu Wei, he once hit the Crown Princess. But the Crown Princess is fierce and slapped the Crown Prince back." Zheng Deyin shuddered at the memory.

Hearing this, Elder Madame Xu hesitated for a moment before nodding, "Alright, I will try to persuade your father, but Lu Wei's influence is deeply rooted and not easy to deal with."

Zheng Deyin sighed, "If I had a mother and younger brother, I wouldn't have to trouble you, Grandmother, at your advanced age. This is my filial impiety."

Elder Madame Xu shared the same thoughts. Zheng Fang had no brothers and came from a humble background. His most trusted person was Pei Shuo, the eldest son of Madame Ji, but would he be willing to risk everything for her?

While Zheng Deyin was privately worried, Huizhen was happily preparing for the festival. No matter what, she needed to have a child first. Whether a daughter or a son, she needed to have one, otherwise, her family would not be foolish. If her father were to use so many troops to help her, he would first need to feel that it was worth it.

How could it be worth it? For example, if she had no sons, helping her husband would be in vain, as her husband might favor another woman's son.

Her father, after all, was a powerful lord, commanding troops in Ji Province. How could he easily mobilize his forces?

The table was filled with snacks, dried fruits, fresh fruits, mooncakes, and more. Huiyin raised her cup and offered a toast to Li Cheng. "As the saying goes, 'When the flowers are in full bloom and the moon is round, people come together.' We've finally been reunited as a couple, and it's definitely worth celebrating."

Li Cheng raised his cup and clinked it against hers. "Princess, please."

They drank their wine in one gulp. Today, Li Cheng had specifically invited all his subordinates who hadn't returned home yet. Understanding the situation, Huiyin politely excused herself. "I'll take my leave now."

Li Cheng was very satisfied with her for this. She had no excessive curiosity and handled situations with great propriety.

He continued to entertain the various generals. These men were brothers who had gone through life and death with him. To put it bluntly, they were people who would lay down their lives for him. As the saying goes, brothers are like limbs, women are like clothes. He naturally had to keep them on his side.

But despite thinking this way, he felt a twinge of guilt when he thought of his wife.

After a few rounds of drinks, the soldiers tactfully excused themselves, as they needed to set off early the next day.

Li Cheng was slightly tipsy. As he walked inside the second gate, the young servants dispersed. Men were not allowed to move around freely inside the second gate, so Li Cheng walked ahead by himself.

As he passed the rock garden, he was surprised to see someone emerge from the shadows. Under the bright moonlight, he squinted and recognized Xun Rou.

Xun Rou had been waiting there for a long time. The lingering summer heat was still warm, but the night air had grown cool after a while.

"Cousin..."

"What are you doing here, cousin?" Li Cheng asked, turning to face her.

Xun Rou was on the verge of tears. "Are you sending me away because of what your wife said? Think about it—how have I treated you all these years, cousin? My grandmother has already betrothed me to you. I consider you my husband. Everyone in Jianye knows this, so I traveled hundreds of miles to be with you. Are you really going to turn your back on me? I am willing to be a secondary consort and serve you and your wife."

She realized that becoming the primary consort was no longer an option. Though she arrived later, her seductive charm and cunning made her a formidable opponent.

She had actually arranged some auspicious carp in the lake today to create an auspicious sign, but it was ruined by her. This woman was far from ordinary.

Given the circumstances, she might as well ask for the position of secondary consort.

Li Cheng lowered his gaze. "Cousin, how can I let you be a secondary consort..."

"Why not? The whole world knows I am already your woman. What face do I have to marry someone else?" Xun Rou wiped her tears with a handkerchief.

Li Cheng stepped back and pointed at her. "Make yourself clear. You were only taken in because you sought refuge at my home. My grandmother pitied you and decided to keep you. What do you mean by saying the whole world knows you are my woman? For the past few years, I've been either in mourning or at war. When have we ever had any real interaction?"

Xun Rou was taken aback and then said, "Before the princess passed away, I copied scriptures with my blood and used my flesh as medicine. Surely you can't deny that, cousin?"

"Your father's official position, your mother's tomb, and the debts your Xun family owes, weren't these all repaid by me? Moreover, I never asked you to copy scriptures with your blood or use your flesh as medicine. No proper doctor would say such things. I even advised you not to do these things as they are completely useless. If you had really listened to me, why didn't you try to stop my grandmother from inviting those charlatans?" Li Cheng was the type to argue until he won, even if it took all day and night.

He loved Wang Chong, who was a well-known atheist.

He didn't believe in any of this.

Xun Rou had never known that this was what Li Cheng truly thought. She tilted her head in disbelief. "Cousin, how can you say this about me? I did it all for your mother. I even managed your estate..."

"Don't even talk about managing my estate. The people you sent over charged me sixty times the market price for eggs and inflated the cost of salt by tenfold. That's not managing an estate—that's being a leech. I am the only legitimate master of our commandery prince's mansion. How is it that the more money was used, the more there seemed to be?" Li Cheng's temper also flared up.

Xun Rou had followed the habits of when the Princess of Wu was alive. When the Princess of Wu was alive, she didn't expose them. Moreover, since she was managing the estate, she also needed to keep the people under the Princess of Wu's command happy and give them some benefits so that they would praise her.

But she couldn't change things on her own, especially since she wasn't the legitimate princess.

But Li Cheng seemed ungrateful, and it made her angry. "Cousin, I did it all for you. How can you say this to me?"

...

Just as Huiyin finished bathing and changing, she heard someone outside shout, "Young Princess, something's wrong! The Little Prince and Miss Xun are arguing."

What the heck? Who knew a man and a woman could argue so intensely?

title: Chapter 19
content:
Chapter 19

◎Advancing by Retreating◎

Huiyin quickly wrapped herself in a jade-colored long vest and rushed over. Even from this distance, she could hear Li Cheng saying, "I never realized you were so eloquent. Why does everything you do end up being our responsibility?"

"My lord, the night is chilly. Why are you still out here? We need to leave for Huai and Si early tomorrow morning," Huiyin called from a distance.

Li Cheng hurried over and, seeing that Huiyin had let her hair down and was lightly dressed, immediately wrapped his arms around her. "Let’s go back inside," he said.

Uncharacteristically, she didn’t ask any more questions, while Li Cheng was lost in thought. People often praised him for his grace and broad-mindedness, but in truth, he wasn’t always like that. He had originally intended to assist the court after inheriting the throne, but after witnessing Lü Wei’s treacherous behavior, he realized Lü wasn’t someone who could achieve anything significant. So, he joined the Prince of Wei. Despite his youth, he had already earned considerable merit. The Prince of Wei had his trusted generals and a close circle of confidants, including his maternal uncles and brothers. Li Cheng could only bide his time and endure.

Today’s argument with Xun Rou made him realize that his youthful impatience hadn’t changed.

Through the thin gauze of her garment, he could feel the softness of her shoulders.

Back in the room, Huiyin yawned and, noticing he was still lost in thought, said, "You’ll leave tomorrow and leave me to deal with her. You know I’m not exactly tactful."

When it came to social skills, she admitted her sister De Yin was far better. De Yin was the type to be thorough and considerate, effortlessly blending in with others. Her ability to make friends seemed almost innate. On the other hand, Huiyin had always believed that mastering skills required solitude.

Those so-called social connections were like illusions. If you fell from grace, those who were once close would avoid you, fearing association.

She never made grand promises or spoke of sisterhood to those who came with her as part of her dowry. Instead, she gave them real power, status, and generous rewards.

Li Cheng looked at Huiyin. "You’re afraid of this? You seem quite talkative to me."

"That’s because you’re my husband, and I don’t hold anything back with you. But every time I meet a stranger, I have to mentally prepare myself," Huiyin admitted. She hadn’t always been so calculating; life had shaped her into this person.

"Fool. There’s nothing to deal with. Her heart is set on becoming the Princess of Huaiyin. Can’t you see that?" Li Cheng suddenly poked her forehead.

He only now realized that his wife was actually a paper tiger, having deceived him completely.

Huiyin generally didn’t want to truly harm her rivals. For example, in her past life, she and Lu Xiao didn’t have any deep-seated animosity. After Lu Xiao’s father died, Huiyin didn’t mock her; she only hoped that Lu Xiao would kill Li Heng to avenge him. If Huiyin became Empress Dowager in the future, she would certainly let Lu Xiao leave the palace to start a new life.

As for Xun Rou, Huiyin looked at Li Cheng and said, "She’s your cousin and has been staying at the mansion. I’ve heard that the Empress Dowager likes her very much. How could I not show her extra respect?"

"You understand me so well, able to clarify things with just a few words. Actually, I could have handled the situation yesterday, but I was just tired of it." Li Cheng knew that if he hadn’t spoken so harshly, Xun Rou would have continued to linger. Yes, it was common for him to casually take in a woman, but it was troublesome. A woman who uses premeditated notions of gratitude to emotionally manipulate you would bring endless trouble.

It seemed that no matter what he said, Huiyin understood him. It wasn’t just superficial wifely obedience; she genuinely put herself in his shoes and thought from his perspective.

That night, they didn’t share their usual intimacy. Instead, they slept separately, as if they had grown closer in a different way.

The next morning, when the door opened, Xun Rou stood there gently and courteously. Her attitude toward Huiyin had become more respectful. "Cousin, I’m here to apologize. Yesterday, I was too impatient and had a bit too much to drink, which led to a drunken outburst."

In truth, Xun Rou’s methods weren’t particularly sophisticated, but she was someone who could be ruthless with herself. Yesterday, she was practically scolded by Li Cheng, yet here she was, early in the morning, softening her stance.

People who make harsh threats in anger are common, but those who can humble themselves after a fit of rage are truly formidable individuals.

Clearly, Li Cheng accepted her sincere apology. As the Prince of Huaiyin, although he usually treated people kindly, it didn’t mean he was entirely under anyone’s control.

Still, there wasn’t any deep-seated hatred between them. "I’m leaving for Huai and Si today. While I’m away, follow your cousin's wife’s arrangements in everything."

Xun Rou smiled and said, "As you wish, cousin. I will definitely listen to your wife."

Li Cheng couldn’t tell if she was being sincere, but his mouth felt bland, so he said to Huiyin, "I feel like eating noodles."

"Why didn’t you say that yesterday? It’s too late to start kneading the dough now," Huiyin complained.

Li Cheng seemed to be in a better mood now that someone else was upset. "I’ll wait a little longer. Go ahead."

Huiyin reluctantly asked someone to start preparing the dough, feeling somewhat annoyed by his behavior.

As Huiyin left, Xun Rou quickly stepped in. The main hall was full of Huiyin’s attendants, and when they saw Xun Rou enter, they all thought she was boldly intruding.

Li Cheng hadn’t expected her to come in and furrowed his brow. Xun Rou quickly added, "Cousin, please don’t misunderstand. I know you’ve never had feelings for me. But I was raised by Grand Dowager Wu, and you know how she is. If I don’t do this, I won’t have peace of mind in the future."

Grand Dowager Wu had never been favored, even in her youth. She followed her son to his fiefdom, but they were never close. Her chambers were often filled with green-eyed black cats. When Li Cheng was a child, seven or eight of these cats would swarm around him, which he found unsettling.

To make matters worse, her temper was unpredictable, prone to sudden outbursts of hysteria.

Li Cheng understood how difficult her life had been and suggested what he thought was the best solution. "If you want to leave the prince’s residence and return to the capital, I can help. After all, I was the one who recommended your father for his position, so he wouldn’t dare cross me."

Compared to Grand Dowager Wu, Xun Rou’s father was the rightful authority to decide her marriage.

Xun Rou shook her head. "If my father were any good, I wouldn’t have run away. Cousin, all I ask is for a place to stay here. I won’t interfere with your relationship with Huiyin. I’ll just be a harmless figurehead, with no improper intentions toward you. All I need is the title of a secondary consort. I promise to stay out of your way. What do you say?"

title: Chapter 20
content:
Chapter 20

◎A Step Ahead◎

Fugui and Qiūfēng, who were both in the room, exchanged exasperated glances when they overheard Xun Rou and Li Cheng. Now she claims she only wants the title of secondary consort, but once she gets her foot in the door, she'll likely ask for much more.

As women, we all know how these games are played.

Huiyin was in the kitchen, carefully making pulled noodles. She realized that Li Cheng was different from most people. He wasn’t easily swayed by moral pressure and could be quite stubborn, even competitive, when it came to proving a point. He was principled, youthful, and full of life—so genuine, so real.

She realized she didn’t really know him as well as she thought.

After cutting the dough into portions and folding several strands together, she began stretching the noodles, completely absorbed in her task. Over the past hour and a half, she thought about Xun Rou. To her, Xun Rou seemed vague, like the other women she had encountered who sought to climb the social ladder. But after reflecting on Xun Rou’s actions, she realized that Xun Rou wasn’t one to give up easily.

Even now, she hadn’t given up. Her persistence was such that a less resolute man would have likely succumbed to her advances by now.

But Li Cheng had refused her not for personal reasons, but because he genuinely disliked her and the idea of being tied down in such a restrictive relationship.

She personally brought the tray over, but Xun Rou was nowhere to be found.

"You’re such a troublemaker, making me go through all this just to make pulled noodles for you. I’m all hot and sweaty now," Huiyin sat down. She believed in returning favors. Over the past month in Xuzhou, Li Cheng had been responsive to almost all her requests.

Li Cheng showed her how much he enjoyed the noodles by finishing every last drop of the soup.

"The noodles are delicious, and the soup is amazing," he said.

Huiyin started, "About Xun Rou..."

But before she could continue, a personal guard came to urge him to leave. Li Cheng hurried off, not even able to say another word.

Fugui, looking a bit embarrassed, said, "I only overheard Miss Xun say that she only wanted the title of secondary consort and nothing else. After that, they went into the inner room, and I couldn’t hear what they said."

"It’s fine. I understand," Huiyin nodded.

She continued to treat Xun Rou the same as always.

A few days after the Mid-Autumn Festival, she received gifts from Jianye, with the Prince of Wei sending the most generous ones. Not only did he send festival gifts, but he also sent gold and clothing.

The Prince of Wei clearly held his nephew in high regard. This time, he even sent her gifts, including exquisite kingfisher feather jewelry, pearls, gold, and jade. The mansion had specialized craftsmen for making jewelry, so Huiyin took half of the materials and had them craft accessories. These gold and jade items, which she had once found vulgar as a child, now delighted her, exuding an air of opulence.

Since Li Cheng left, Xun Rou had also begun to keep to herself, rarely seeing even He Niangzi.

"Yun Hui, please take Xun Gu Niang her monthly allowance. This pair of earrings is a gift from me. Also, autumn is approaching. The seasons in Xuzhou are distinct, and the seamstresses will soon be making clothes. They’ll be looking for her in the next few days," Huiyin said. She wouldn’t write to ask Li Cheng about what happened that day. Xun Rou certainly wouldn’t tell her, so she had Yun Hui try her luck. After all, Yun Hui’s expression had been different the last time she mentioned Xun Rou.

Yun Hui followed Huiyin’s instructions without hesitation and quickly went to see Xun Rou.

At that moment, Xun Rou was practicing calligraphy. Her handwriting was exquisite, and she could even write with both hands. She recalled that her cousin had once praised her skill.

Looking up, she saw Yun Hui enter and offered a faint smile.

"You’re here. Are you here to watch my downfall? Let me tell you, you won’t get the chance."

Yun Hui placed the tray down formally. "I’ve come on behalf of the young princess. This is your monthly allowance, and these earrings are a gift from her..."

Xun Rou raised an eyebrow. "Are you mocking me for having to rely on her for money while living under her roof?"

"Miss Xun, you’re misunderstanding me. You are the mistress, and I am just a servant following the young princess’s orders," Yun Hui said, her expression unchanged.

Xun Rou smiled and said, "There's no need to put on an act with me. I'm afraid the only one who doesn't know about your little schemes is my cousin. He is a man of deep feelings and righteousness, treating everyone around him well. But if he were to find out what you've been up to, how would he look at you?"

Yun Hui remained calm, "This servant does not understand what you mean."

"You know very well." Xun Rou wanted to expose her, but thinking that Princess Zheng also disliked her, why should she help reveal her secrets? She sneered coldly and stopped.

After saying this, Yun Hui prepared to leave, her expression unchanged, but she curved her lips slightly as she walked out.

Soon it was September, and the weather began to turn cool, the climate pleasant. In Ji Province, snow might fall in October, but now it was sunny and bright. The gardeners had started cultivating new flowers, and Huizhao toured the gardens with her maids and servants. As the highest-ranking person in Xu Prefecture, she did not need to go out for social engagements.

She almost knew all the hundreds of people in the mansion, familiar with their roles, and could assign tasks normally, beginning to manage them.

"Mother Nan, you are my wet nurse; you must not be as you were in the Zheng family. I don't trust the people around here much," Huizhao reminded her.

Mother Nan nodded, "Yes, yes. Mother used to have no guard up, being accustomed to life in the Zheng family. Now, I should try to help the young princess more."

In fact, with the male head of Huaiyin Mansion away, the management was entirely entrusted to the female head, making Huizhao's life much easier than when she was in the Eastern Palace.

After the two of them had walked some distance, Mother Nan asked, "I noticed you seem to have let off Miss Xun? Yesterday, her maid went out, and you allowed it."

"Yes, what's there to talk about with someone who has already lost?" Huizhao had already guessed most of it.

If Xun Rou were truly chosen as the secondary consort, the young prince would not have failed to consult her. He might not love her, but he respected her position as the principal wife, at least for now.

Mother Nan, however, said, "What if she's just pretending? Openly acting carefree, but secretly plotting something else?"

Huizhao laughed, "What do I have to fear? If she becomes the secondary consort, it would be worse for her than it is now." A cousin, a guest, a member of the Xun family, was hard to deal with, but if she really became the secondary consort, she would be under the legitimate control of the princess.

She was not Zheng Deyin, unable to handle even someone like Xun Rou, whom Li Cheng did not favor.

Huiyin is currently constrained by her position and hasn't fully secured her place yet, so she has to be patient. After all, she faced someone as dangerous as Dong Yuniang in her past life—why would she fear someone like Xun Rou?

However, she needs to show Li Cheng that she's being patient. For now, she can't act, and she's also waiting for the right moment to strike.

"Mom, just a little longer. Everything will become clear soon enough."

"Wait? Wait for what, exactly?"

Nanny Nan didn’t really understand what was going on. Despite being from Jizhou and having a reputation for being resourceful, she always felt out of her depth in front of the Princess.

Huiyin smiled and shook her head. Then, she sat down to write another letter to Li Cheng, describing the garden’s flower beds. She mentioned the Double Ninth Festival outing and how, thinking of him in Huai and Si, she used chrysanthemums from the garden to bake some flower cakes for him to enjoy. Knowing he didn’t drink alcohol while in the military, she decided not to send any wine.

When Li Cheng returned to his tent, he found the flower cakes Huiyin had sent. They were translucent, not greasy, and tasted delightfully sweet.

His life was actually quite fulfilling. As the only son of the King and Queen, he was pampered, especially by them. Yet, for some reason, he had always felt a deep sense of insecurity since childhood, as if everything could be taken away at any moment.

Now, with someone always thinking of him, he felt genuinely happy, even though he didn’t say it aloud. Especially since Princess Zheng knew how to keep things in balance. She only acted playful and affectionate in private, teasing him with shy words, but in public, she was always composed and proper. Her letters didn’t contain love poems, just a few simple words. But the fact that she thought of making flower cakes for him when she saw chrysanthemums showed how much she cared.

But what could he send back to her?

About half a month later, Huiyin received an exquisitely crafted jewelry box inlaid with gold, enamel, and pearls. She was delighted. Like most women, she loved beautiful things, and she hadn’t expected Li Cheng to go to such lengths to send her this gift.

When Xun Rou came to greet her, she noticed that Huiyin’s dressing table was nearly covered with jewelry, and a maid was holding a hairpin up to her head.

"Cousin-in-law, Miss Miao invited me to a poetry gathering today," Xun Rou said humbly.

Huiyin smiled and said, "Go ahead. I’ll have the servants get the carriage ready for you. Just be careful."

Xun Rou nodded. "Thank you, Cousin-in-law."

She finished speaking and, supported by Meixiang, went out. Huiyin watched her departing figure and sneered coldly, "A jumping clown who doesn't know when death approaches."

The last time Xun Rou had pleaded with Li Cheng, she asked to stay in Huaiyin Mansion to avoid punishment by Grand Dowager Wu upon her return. She planned to go back during the New Year, demonstrating that she had truly done her best. If she couldn't become the secondary consort, it wasn't her fault, and the Grand Dowager wouldn't punish her. After a moment's thought, her cousin agreed. However, how could she really leave? Now, she was still scheming. First, she would occupy Huiyin with external matters, making her a laughingstock, and then step in at a critical moment.

Sure enough, after Xun Rou left this time, Lady Miao came to Huiyin, saying that with refugees running rampant, she wanted to ask how Huaiyin Mansion planned to settle them and whether the local wealthy families should help.

Huiyin smiled and said, "Isn't this matter still under the jurisdiction of the prefect and county magistrate? Why are they asking us women to handle it?"

Lady Miao often flattered Huiyin and, feeling close to her, sincerely said, "I'm thinking of your reputation. The Prince of Huaiyin has just arrived in Xuzhou and is in the process of winning people's hearts. If you take the lead, it will be good for both your reputation and the mansion's."

"What you said makes sense, but I'm pregnant now and afraid I can't exert myself. How about this: I'll have my cousin, Miss Xun, go on our behalf, so the local wealthy families in Xuzhou can see how capable she is. You don't know this, but the Grand Dowager has entrusted me and the Little Prince to help her find a good husband for Miss Xun." Huiyin said with a smile.

Her health was good, and Li Cheng hadn't given her any cold medicine like that villain Li Heng had done. She was already three months pregnant and had stabilized the fetus. Yesterday, she had already sent a letter to Li Cheng, mentioning that she was pregnant and probably couldn't take care of Xun Rou.

Lady Miao quickly congratulated her, "I didn't expect the young princess to be pregnant. Yes, how could we trouble you? We'll handle it ourselves and consider it good fortune for the future heir."

"Alright, then when you succeed, I'll have Miss Xun go on my behalf," Huiyin said with a smile.

Lady Miao immediately nodded and thought about what valuable items she should gather to send over, aiming to be the first to offer congratulations at the young princess's door.

Naturally, since this idea came from Xun Rou, she also informed Xun Rou about it.

Xun Rou's heart tightened. "You mean my cousin-in-law is pregnant?"

Lady Miao smiled, "Indeed, I think the young princess is very fortunate to conceive just three months after marriage. However, she also has plans for you. She said that when the refugee settlement is successfully handled, she will have you go on her behalf."

Xun Rou broke out in a cold sweat. These days, besides visiting the Miao family, she had been in contact with the old subordinates of Grand Dowager Wu, meticulously planning to incite refugees to cause trouble and destruction on the day the settlement was completed. The money had already been paid. She had been worried that Huiyin wouldn't participate and had deliberately let Lady Miao and others plan first, intending to let Huiyin take the lead.

Now that Huiyin was quietly pregnant and wanted her to go on her behalf, as soon as Lady Miao left, she called Meixiang. "Take my personal token and stop our people from carrying out the plan."

If she went, of course, no one should offend her, or all the blame would fall on her.

Meixiang immediately prepared to go out but couldn't even leave the courtyard. She hurried back and said, "Miss, it's not good. The guards at the gate said the young princess ordered them not to let anyone out, fearing that villains might cause trouble because she is pregnant."

Xun Rou almost fainted, realizing that Huiyin was indeed more clever than she had thought.
